# Question

Write a pig latin transformer called `pig_latinify` that operates on a vector of strings. It iterates over each string and changes it to pig latin. Each iteration should run on a separate thread.

Here's how you can implement this in Julia using multiple threads from the Threads standard library:

```julia
using Base.Threads

function pig_latinify(strings::Vector{String})
    results = similar(strings) # Create an array of same size to store results

    @threads for i in eachindex(strings)
        word = strings[i]
        if length(word) > 0 && isalpha(first(word)) # Check if it's not empty and starts with a letter
            first_letter, rest = uppercase(word[1]), lowercase(word[2:end])
            results[i] = "${rest}${first_letter}ay"  # Apply Pig Latin transformation
        else
            results[i] = word # Leave the string as is if it doesn't start with a letter or is empty
        end
    end
    
    return results
end
```

This function will apply the pig latin transformation to each word in the input vector of strings. Note that this function assumes all words are alphabetic and does not handle punctuation or special characters within words. It also doesn't handle upper case letters in the middle of words, so "helloWorld" would become "elloWorldhay".
